member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient
member.summary: Instances of this class can connect to an IMAP server
member.remarks: Before calling one of the Connect methods set the Server and Credentials properties at a minimum and consider setting the MailboxCacheData property

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: Used to tag trace messages in case you have multiple instances in one exe

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.InstanceName
member.summary: The instance name used to tag trace messages

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.SynchronizationContext
member.summary: The synchronisation context on which callbacks (including events) are made
member.remarks: If set to null callbacks are made by the thread that discovers the need to do the callback

member.name: E:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.ResponseText
member.summary: Fired when the server sends response text
member.remarks: The IMAP spec says that alerts MUST be brought to the users attention

member.name: E:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.CallbackException
member.summary: Fired when an exception is raised in by a callback
member.remarks: The library ignores the exception other than raising this event

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.Timeout
member.summary: Sets the timeout for calls that involve network access

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.CancellableCount
member.summary: Returns the number of currently running cancellable operations

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels currently running cancellable operations

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.HomeServerReferral
member.summary: The login referral (rfc 2221), if received

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.IgnoreCapabilities
member.summary: Capabilities that you wish the instance to ignore
member.remarks: Useful for testing or if your server (or the library) has a bug in its implementation of an IMAP extension

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.Server
member.summary: The server that the instance should connect to
member.remarks: See the SetServer methods for an easy way to set this property

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.SetServer(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the server that the instance should connect to, defaulting the port to 143 and SSL to false

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.SetServer(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the server that the instance should connect to, specifying whether SSL is required or not. If SSL is required the port is set to 993, otherwise it is set to 143.

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.SetServer(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the server that the instance should connect to, specifying the port and whether SSL is required or not.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.Credentials
member.summary: The credentials to be used to connect to the server
member.remarks: See the SetXXXCredentials methods for an easy way to set this property

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.SetXOAuth2Credentials(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: To connect to GMail if you don't want to 'Allow less secure apps' on your account and have implemented OAUTH2 in your application
member.remarks: Note that I haven't tested this
member.param: Try using this method of authentication even if the server doesn't advertise it

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.MailboxReferrals
member.summary: Set this to true if you can handle mailbox referrals
member.remarks: If this is set to false the instance will not return remote mailboxes in mailbox lists. Being able to handle mailbox referrals means handling the exceptions that may be raised by the library when accessing remote mailboxes. See RFC 2193 and cUnsuccessfulCompletionException

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.MailboxCacheData
member.summary: Determines what details about mailboxes are available from the mailbox cache
member.remarks: May only be set when the instance is unconnected

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.NetworkWriteConfiguration
member.summary: Controls the size of writes to the network
member.remarks: You might want to limit this to increase the speed with which you can terminate the instance. Higher values are presumably more efficient.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.IdleConfiguration
member.summary: Sets parameters that control what the instance does while idle
member.remarks: Set to null to stop the instance from doing anything. If set, the instance determines that it is idle after the specified time and then issues periodic IDLE (rfc 2177) or CHECK/ NOOP commands.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.AppendStreamReadConfiguration
member.summary: The default control on the size of reads from streams provided to append
member.remarks: You might want to limit this to increase the speed with which you can terminate the instance.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.FetchCacheItemsConfiguration
member.summary: The configuration that controls the number of messages fetched at one time
member.remarks: You might want to limit this to increase the speed with which you can cancel the fetch.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.FetchBodyReadConfiguration
member.summary: The configuration that controls the number of bytes fetched from the server at one time
member.remarks: You might want to limit this to increase the speed with which you can cancel the fetch.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.FetchBodyWriteConfiguration
member.summary: The configuration that controls the number of bytes written to the output stream when fetching
member.remarks: You might want to limit this to increase the speed with which you can cancel the fetch.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.Encoding
member.summary: The encoding to use when UTF8 (rfc 6855) is not supported directly by the server

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.ClientId
member.summary: The ID details to send to the server if it supports the ID command (rfc 2971)
member.remarks: This is the ASCII version of the information. If the server supports UTF8 and a UTF8 version of the ID information is set, that version will be used in preference to this version.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.ClientIdUTF8
member.summary: The ID details to send to the server if it supports the ID command (rfc 2971)
member.remarks: This is the UTF8 version of the information. If the server does not support UTF8 then the ASCII version will be used.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.ServerId
member.summary: The ID details of the server if it supports the ID command (rfc 2971)
member.remarks: Will only have a value after connecting to the server.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.Namespaces
member.summary: The namespace details for the connected account.
member.remarks: Will only have a value after connecting to the server. If namespaces (rfc 2342) are not supported the library creates one personal namespace using the delimiter retrieved using LIST.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.SelectedMailboxDetails
member.summary: Details of the currently selected mailbox, if any

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.SelectedMailbox
member.summary: The currently selected mailbox, if any

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.Mailbox(work.bacome.imapclient.cMailboxName)
member.summary: Returns a mailbox instance for the mailbox with the specified name

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.HasCachedChildren(work.bacome.imapclient.support.iMailboxHandle)
member.summary: Intended for internal use by the library
member.remarks: Checks if the cache contains mailboxes that are children of the specified mailbox. Used when the server has not indicated whether the mailbox has children or not.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.EventSubscriptionCounts
member.summary: Intended for debugging use.
member.remarks: Returns the number of subscriptions to the various events. Used to check that events are being 'unsubscribed' correctly.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.DefaultCacheItems
member.summary: Specifies the cache items that are fetched by default when message lists are generated using the mailbox's message list methods

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.DefaultSort
member.summary: Specifies the sort that is used by default when message lists are generated using the mailbox's message list methods

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.Subscribed(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Char},System.Boolean,work.bacome.imapclient.fMailboxCacheDataSets)
member.summary: List subscribed mailboxes using an IMAP wildcard search
member.param: The search string including IMAP wildcards
The mailbox name hierarchy delimiter
Include in the list mailboxes that are not themselves subscribed but that have subscribed children
The sets of data that should be cached in the mailbox cache for the returned mailboxes

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.SubscribedAsync(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Char},System.Boolean,work.bacome.imapclient.fMailboxCacheDataSets)
member.summary: List subscribed mailboxes using an IMAP wildcard search
member.param: The search string including IMAP wildcards
The mailbox name hierarchy delimiter
Include in the list mailboxes that are not themselves subscribed but that have subscribed children
The sets of data that should be cached in the mailbox cache for the returned mailboxes

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.Mailboxes(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Char},work.bacome.imapclient.fMailboxCacheDataSets)
member.summary: List mailboxes using an IMAP wildcard search
member.param: The search string including IMAP wildcards
The mailbox name hierarchy delimiter
The sets of data that should be cached in the mailbox cache for the returned mailboxes

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.MailboxesAsync(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Char},work.bacome.imapclient.fMailboxCacheDataSets)
member.summary: List mailboxes using an IMAP wildcard search
member.param: The search string including IMAP wildcards
The mailbox name hierarchy delimiter
The sets of data that should be cached in the mailbox cache for the returned mailboxes

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.Poll
member.summary: Poll the server using CHECK (if a mailbox is selected) and NOOP to see if the server has pending notifications for us

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.PollAsync
member.summary: Poll the server using CHECK (if a mailbox is selected) and NOOP to see if the server has pending notifications for us

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.fMailboxCacheDataSets
member.summary: Sets of data that can be fetched about a mailbox

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.fMailboxCacheDataSets.list
member.summary: Data returned by the LIST command
member.remarks: Affects the following properties of the mailbox class ALWAYS: Exists, CanHaveChildren, CanSelect, IsMarked, IsRemote IF the internal mailbox cache is caching the backing data: HasChildren (fMailboxCacheData.children), Contains* and IsArchive (fMailboxCacheData.specialuse)

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.fMailboxCacheDataSets.lsub
member.summary: Data returned by the LSUB command
member.remarks: Affects the IsSubscribed property of the mailbox class

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.fMailboxCacheDataSets.status
member.summary: Data returned by the STATUS command
member.remarks: Affects the following properties of the mailbox class IF the internal mailbox cache is caching the backing data: MessageCount, RecentCount, UIDNext, UIDValidity, UnseenCount, HighestModSeq

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.eStoreOperation
member.summary: The store operation type

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.eStoreOperation.add
member.summary: add flags to the flags already set

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.eStoreOperation.remove
member.summary: remove flags from the flags already set

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.eStoreOperation.replace
member.summary: replace the flags

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.fCacheAttributes
member.summary: A set of IMAP message attributes

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cCopyFeedback
member.summary: Returned from copy operations if the server supports the UIDCOPY response code of rfc 4315
member.remarks: Contains pairs of UIDs of messages involved in the copy.

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.eAccountType
member.summary: The type of account

members.member: the library has no idea about the account that is in use "
the account is an anonymous one "

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cAccountId
member.summary: Describes an IMAP account

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cAccountId.Host
member.summary: The host that contains the account

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cAccountId.Type
member.summary: The account type
member.remarks: If the connection was PREAUTHed then this will be none

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cAccountId.UserId
member.summary: If account's userid, if any

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.fCapabilities
member.summary: A set of server capabilities
member.remarks: The elements of this enum are all the capabilities that the library understands in some way. The full list of server capabilities can be found in a cCapabilities instance

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cCapabilities
member.summary: A set of server capabilities

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cCapabilities.Capabilities
member.summary: Contains the capabilities as presented by the server

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cCapabilities.AuthenticationMechanisms
member.summary: Contains the authentication mechanisms supported by the server

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cCapabilities.EffectiveCapabilities
member.summary: Contains the set of server capabilities that the instance is assuming
member.remarks: This is the set of recognised capabilities less the set that the instance has been told to ignore

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cCredentials
member.summary: Describes a set of credentials

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cCredentials.Type
member.summary: The account type that the credentials give access to

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cCredentials.UserId
member.summary: The userid for the credentials
member.remarks: may be null for anonymous and NONE; must not be null otherwise

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cCredentials.Login
member.summary: The parameters to use with the IMAP LOGIN command for these credentials

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cCredentials.TryAllSASLs
member.summary: Whether all authentication mechanisms should be tried regardless of whether they are advertised by the server or not

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cCredentials.mSASLs
member.summary: The set of SASL objects to try when authenticating

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cCredentials.None
member.summary: An empty set of credentials
member.remarks: Useful for testing, checking what capabilities the server offers without connecting and for pre-authorised connections

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cCredentials.Anonymous(System.String,work.bacome.imapclient.eTLSRequirement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Generates an anonymous set of credentials
member.param: The trace information to be sent to the server when connecting
The TLS requirement for these credentials to be used
Try AUTHENTICATE ANONYMOUS even if it isn't advertised

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cCredentials.Plain(System.String,System.String,work.bacome.imapclient.eTLSRequirement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Generates a plain set of credentials
member.param: The TLS requirement for these credentials to be used
Try AUTHENTICATE PLAIN even if it isn't advertised

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cCredentials.XOAuth2(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Generates an XOAUTH2 set of credentials
member.remarks: To connect to GMail if you don't want to 'Allow less secure apps' on your account and have implemented OAUTH2 in your application. Note that I haven't tested this.
member.param: Try AUTHENTICATE XOAUTH2 even if it isn't advertised

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cLogin
member.summary: Parameters to use with the LOGIN command

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cLogin.TLSRequirement
member.summary: The TLS requirement for LOGIN to be used with this userid and password

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cLogin.TryConstruct(System.String,System.String,work.bacome.imapclient.eTLSRequirement,work.bacome.imapclient.cLogin@)
member.summary: Tries to create a cLogin instance. LOGIN only allows ASCII userids and passwords, so this may fail.

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cServer
member.summary: Specifies an IMAP server

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cServer.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Port defaulted to 143 and SSL to false

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cServer.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Port defaulted to 143 if SSL is false, otherwise 993

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.eTLSRequirement
member.summary: The TLS requirement
member.remarks: TLS can be established by specifying SSL in the server to be used or by the use of the STARTTLS command during connect if it is supported by the server. The library will automatically use STARTTLS if it is offered and the server does not specify SSL unless the instance has been told to ignore the STARTTLS capability.

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.eTLSRequirement.indifferent
member.summary: Don't care whether TLS is active or not

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.eTLSRequirement.required
member.summary: TLS must be active

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.eTLSRequirement.disallowed
member.summary: TLS must not be active

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.fMailboxCacheData
member.summary: A set of optionally cached mailbox attributes

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.fMailboxCacheData.subscribed
member.summary: the backing data for the cMailbox.IsSubscribed property

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.fMailboxCacheData.children
member.summary: the backing data for the cMailbox.HasChildren property

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.fMailboxCacheData.specialuse
member.summary: the backing data for the cMailbox Contains* properties and the IsArchive property

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.fMailboxCacheData.messagecount
member.summary: the backing data for the cMailbox.MessageCount property

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.fMailboxCacheData.recentcount
member.summary: the backing data for the cMailbox.RecentCount property

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.fMailboxCacheData.uidnext
member.summary: the backing data for the cMailbox.UIDNext property

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.fMailboxCacheData.uidvalidity
member.summary: the backing data for the cMailbox.UIDValidity property

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.fMailboxCacheData.unseencount
member.summary: the backing data for the cMailbox.UnseenCount property

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.fMailboxCacheData.highestmodseq
member.summary: the backing data for the cMailbox.HighestModSeq property
member.remarks: Note that if the mailbox does not support CONDSTORE (RFC 7162) then the value will be null

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cStoreFeedbackItemBase
member.summary: Base class for feedback on one message from a store operation

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cStoreFeedbackItemBase.ReceivedFlagsUpdate
member.summary: True if a fetch response containing the flags for this message was received during the store operation

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cStoreFeedbackItemBase.WasNotUnchangedSince
member.summary: True if this message was mentioned in the RFC 7162 MODIFIED response code from the store operation

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cStoreFeedbackItemBase.IncrementSummary(work.bacome.imapclient.support.iMessageHandle,work.bacome.imapclient.eStoreOperation,work.bacome.imapclient.cSettableFlags,work.bacome.imapclient.sStoreFeedbackSummary@)
member.summary: Intended for internal use

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cStoreFeedbackItem
member.summary: Contains feedback on one message from a store operation

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cStoreFeedback
member.summary: Contains feedback from a store operation

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cStoreFeedback.Summary
member.summary: Gets a summary of the feedback

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.sStoreFeedbackSummary
member.summary: A summary of a store operation
member.remarks: each message counts towards ONE of the updated, wasnotunchangedsince, expunged, unknown, reflects and notreflects counts generally expunged + notreflects is the number of definite non-updates generally notreflects > 0 indicates that a poll of the server may be worth trying to get any pending updates (which should convert all the notreflects to expunged or reflects) unknown indicates that a blind update was done so there isn't enough information to say if the store happened or not

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.sStoreFeedbackSummary.UpdatedCount
member.summary: the number where a fetch was received during the command execution and no 'modified' response was received (=> _likely_ to have been updated by the command)

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.sStoreFeedbackSummary.WasNotUnchangedSinceCount
member.summary: a 'modified' response was received (=> _NOT_ updated by the command)

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.sStoreFeedbackSummary.ExpungedCount
member.summary: the number where the message handle indicates that the message is expunged

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.sStoreFeedbackSummary.UnknownCount
member.summary: the number where the handle isn't known (uidstore) or the handle does not contain the flags

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.sStoreFeedbackSummary.ReflectsOperationCount
member.summary: the flags in the handle reflect the update

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.sStoreFeedbackSummary.NotReflectsOperationCount
member.summary: the flags in the handle do not reflect the update

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cUIDStoreFeedbackItem
member.summary: Contains feedback on one message from a UID store operation

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cUIDStoreFeedback
member.summary: Contains feedback from a UID store operation

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cUIDStoreFeedback.Summary
member.summary: Gets a summary of the feedback

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox
member.summary: Provides an API that allows interaction with an IMAP mailbox

member.name: E:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.MessageDelivery
member.summary: Fired when messages are delivered into the mailbox

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.Path
member.summary: The fully qualified name of the mailbox

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.Delimiter
member.summary: The hierarchy delimiter used in the mailbox path

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.ParentPath
member.summary: The path of the parent mailbox
member.remarks: Will be null if there is no parent mailbox

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.Name
member.summary: The name of the mailbox
member.remarks: As compared to the path: this does not include the hierarchy

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.Exists
member.summary: True if the mailbox exists
member.remarks: Subscribed mailboxes do not need to actually exist. Neither do parts of a real mailboxes hierarchy.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.CanHaveChildren
member.summary: False if the mailbox can definitely not contain child mailboxes
member.remarks: see the IMAP \Noinferiors flag

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.CanSelect
member.summary: False if the mailbox cannot be selected
member.remarks: see the IMAP \Noselect flag

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.IsMarked
member.summary: Indicates if the mailbox has been marked "interesting" by the server
member.remarks: see the IMAP \Marked and \Unmarked flags

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.IsRemote
member.summary: If true the mailbox is definitely a remote mailbox. If false the mailbox is not definitely a remote mailbox, but it may be.
member.remarks: Remote mailboxes will never be returned by the library if the cIMAPClient.MailboxReferrals is set to false.

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.fMessageProperties
member.summary: Specifies a set of message class properties

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cCacheItems
member.summary: Specifies a set of items that can be cached in the internal message cache
member.remarks: Note that the class has three implicit conversions, including one from fMessageProperties.

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cCacheItems.Attributes
member.summary: A set of IMAP message attributes

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cCacheItems.Names
member.summary: A list of header field names

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cSortItem
member.summary: An item to sort messages by
member.remarks: Use the static instances that are members of the class to improve readability of your sort specification

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cSortItem.Attribute
member.summary: If sorting is to be done client-side this is the message cache attribute that is required

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cSortItem.Desc
member.summary: Indicates descending sort

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cSort
member.summary: Defines a sort order for message lists

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cSort.Compare(work.bacome.imapclient.support.iMessageHandle,work.bacome.imapclient.support.iMessageHandle)
member.summary: Compares two message handles according to the sort definition. If the attributes required for the comparision are not in the message cache the results are undefined.

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cSort.Compare(work.bacome.imapclient.cMessage,work.bacome.imapclient.cMessage)
member.summary: Compares two messages according to the sort definition. If the attributes required for the comparision are not in the message cache the attributes are fetched.

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cSort.Attributes(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Returns the set of message attributes required by this sort and whether SORT=DISPLAY (RFC 5957) support is required for the server to do the sort.
member.param: Set to true if SORT=DISPLAY (RFC 5957) support is required for the server to do the sort
member.returns: The set of message attributes required by this sort

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cCommandResult.ResultType
member.summary: The IMAP command completion type

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cCommandResult.ResponseText
member.summary: The IMAP response text associated with the command completion

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPException
member.summary: Base class for all of the library's custom exceptions

member.summary: The response text associated with the 'NO'

member.summary: If set an indication that ignoring these capabilities may have prevented the exception

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cProtocolErrorException
member.summary: Thrown on a 'NO' or 'BAD' command response
member.remarks: Thrown on a 'NO' only when the 'NO' is an unexpected possibility

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cProtocolErrorException.CommandResult
member.summary: The command result associated with the response

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cProtocolErrorException.TryIgnoring
member.summary: If set an indication that ignoring these capabilities may have prevented the exception

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cUnexpectedServerActionException
member.summary: thrown when something happens that shouldn't (according to my reading of the rfcs)

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cUnexpectedServerActionException.TryIgnoring
member.summary: If set an indication that ignoring these capabilities may have prevented the exception

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cInternalErrorException
member.summary: thrown when something happens that shouldn't

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cConnectByeException
member.summary: thrown when the server said bye at connect

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cConnectByeException.ResponseText
member.summary: The response text associated with the 'BYE'

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cHomeServerReferralException
member.summary: thrown when the server rejects connection but suggests that we try a different server

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cHomeServerReferralException.ResponseText
member.summary: The response text associated with the rejection

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cCredentialsException
member.summary: thrown when the server didn't accept the credentials provided

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cCredentialsException.ResponseText
member.summary: Filled in if there was an explicit rejection of the credetials by the server

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cAuthenticationMechanismsException
member.summary: thrown to indicate that the inability to connect is related to the lack of usable authentication mechanisms offered by the server

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cAuthenticationMechanismsException.TLSIssue
member.summary: This is set to true if the problem might be fixed by using TLS

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cUnilateralByeException
member.summary: thrown to indicate that a server initiated 'BYE' occurred

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cUnilateralByeException.ResponseText
member.summary: The response text associated with the 'BYE'

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cSASLSecurityException
member.summary: thrown when SASL security layer encoding or decoding fails

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cPipelineConflictException
member.summary: thrown when there are two pipelined commands that conflict in some way

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cPipelineStoppedException
member.summary: thrown when the internal command pipeline has stopped processing commands

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cStreamClosedException
member.summary: thrown when the internal network stream has been closed

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cUIDValidityChangedException
member.summary: thrown when the UIDValidity changed while doing something that depended on it not changing

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cContentTransferDecodingException
member.summary: thrown when the CTE can't be handled

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cFilterMSNException
member.summary: thrown when a handle can't resolved when building the filter

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cFilterMSNException.Handle
member.summary: The handle that couldn't be resolved to an MSN

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cResponseText.Code
member.summary: The IMAP response text code associated with the response text
member.remarks: If there was no code 'none' is used. If there was a code but it wasn't recognised then 'unknown' is used here and the text of the code is stored in UnknownCodeAtom.

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cResponseText.Strings
member.summary: Data associated with the response text code
member.remarks: For badcharset it may contain the list of valid charsets. For referral it should contain the URL(s).

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cResponseText.UnknownCodeAtom
member.summary: If the response text code was unrecognised the text of the code is made available here

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cResponseText.UnknownCodeText
member.summary: If the unrecognised response text code had text following it the text is made available here

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cResponseText.Text
member.summary: The response text

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cResponseTextEventArgs.TextType
member.summary: The response text type
member.remarks: Indicates the situation in which the response text was received

member.name: F:work.bacome.imapclient.cResponseTextEventArgs.Text
member.summary: The response text
